intro: Syntherisma praecox, commonly known as the early flowering syntherism, is a rare and delicate plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Syntherismaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, which helps to reflect excess sunlight. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Syntherisma praecox is considered a conservation concern.
